required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ofatumumab in Patients With Relapsed/Progressive Diffused Large B-Cell Lymphoma (DLBCL) Ineligible for or Relapse/Progression After Transplant
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label, Single-arm. Multi-center Phase 2 Trial With Ofatumumab in Patients With Relapsed/Progressive Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma (DLBCL) Ineligible for Transplant or Relapse/Progression After Autologous Transplant

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this trial is to determine the effect of ofatumumab in patients with Diffused Large B-Cell Lymphoma (DLBCL) ineligible for transplant or relapsed after autologous transplant

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Objective Response
primary_outcome.time_frame: 6-month period from start of treatment (up to Week 24)
primary_outcome.description: Objective response of ofatumumab treatment was assessed according to the "revised response criteria for malignant lymphoma." Participants with objective response were defined as responders with complete remission (CR) or partial remission (PR) of disease. CR is defined as the disappearance of all evidence of disease, and PR is defined as the regression of measurable disease with no new sites of disease.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Classified as Responders and Non-responders for Objective Response
primary_outcome.time_frame: 6-month period from start of treatment (up to Week 24)
primary_outcome.description: According to the "revised response criteria for malignant lymphoma," responders included participants with CR and PR, and non-responders included participants with stable disease (SD) and progressive disease (PD). Participants not evaluable (NE) were also considered to be non-responders. PD is defined as any new lesion or an increase by more than or equal to 50% of previously involved sites from baseline. SD is defined as failure to attain CR, PR, or PD.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of start of treatment to 2 years or withdrawal
secondary_outcome.description: The duration of response was defined as the time from the initial response (CR or PR) to the time of relapse, progression, or death. If the participant was lost to follow-up, the endpoint was censored, and the censoring date was the date of the last attended visit at which the endpoint was assessed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of start of treatment to 2 years or withdrawal
secondary_outcome.description: PFS was defined as the time from treatment start until progression or death.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Next Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma (DLBCL) Therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of start of treatment to 5 years or withdrawal
secondary_outcome.description: Time to next DLBCL therapy was defined as the time from the first infusion date to the time of the first administration of the next DLBCL treatment other than ofatumumab. If the participants were lost to follow-up, the endpoint was censored, and the censoring date was the date of the last attended visit at which the endpoint was assessed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of start of treatment to 5 years or withdrawal
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival is defined as the time from first infusion to death. Overall survival was a secondary endpoint in the study. However, since many participants withdrew from the study after developing disease progression overall survival could not be reliably estimated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Positive Human Anti-human Antibodies (HAHA) at Screening and at Visits 12, 13, 14, and 18
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening visit (=<14 days before treatment start), Visit 12 (Month 6), Visit 13 (Month 9), Visit 14 (Month 12), and Visit 18 (Month 24)
secondary_outcome.description: HAHA are indicators of immune response to ofatumumab. Blood samples were collected from participants at Visits 1, 12, 13, 14, and 18 and analyzed in batches. The number of participants with positive results at each visit is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Percent Change From Baseline in CD45+CD19+ and CD45+CD20+ Cells in the Peripheral Blood at the Indicated Visits
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Visit 10 (Week 8), Visit 11 (Week 11), Visit 12 (Month 6), Visit 13 (Month 9), Visit 14 (Month 12), Visit 15 (Month 15), Visit 16 (Month 18), Visit 17 (Month 21), Visit 18 (Month 24), Visit 19 (Month 30), Visit 20 (Month 36)
secondary_outcome.description: B cells (CD45+CD19+ and CD45+CD20+) were measured in peripheral blood samples by flow cytometry. Percent change from Baseline = (value at the indicated visits minus the value at Baseline divided by the value at Baseline) * 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Experienced at Least One Adverse Event (AE)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time frame is from date of start of treatment to 2 years or withdrawal
secondary_outcome.description: An AE is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant administered a pharmaceutical product that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. The protocol-defined AE reporting period was from the first infusion (Visit 2/Week 0) to Visit 18 (Month 24 of follow-up) or time of withdrawal (treatment and follow-up).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Screening in Complement (CH50) Levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening and post-baseline visits (last visit was to occur 24 months post first dose)
secondary_outcome.description: CH50 was mistakenly registered as an outcome measure with the protocol record. Samples were not collected, and no analysis will take place. Thus, no data will be reported for this outcome measure.

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC(0-inf) and AUC(0-168) for Ofatumumab at the Eighth Infusion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 9 (Week 7; up to 11 months after last dose)
secondary_outcome.description: AUC is defined as the area under the ofatumumab concentration-time curve as a measure of drug exposure. AUC(0-168) is the AUC from the start of infusion to 168 hours after the start of the infusion; AUC(0-inf) is the AUC from the start of infusion extrapolated to infinity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cmax and Ctrough for Ofatumumab at the First and Eighth Infusions
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax is defined as the maximum concentration of drug in serum samples. Ctrough is defined as the minimum observed concentration prior to the start of the next dose. No drug is present prior to the first infusion; therefore, there are no Ctrough results for the first dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Half-life (T1/2) for Ofatumumab at the Eighth Infusion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 9 (Week 7; up to 11 months after last dose)
secondary_outcome.description: t1/2 is defined as terminal half-life and is the time required for the amount of drug in the body to decrease by half.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clearance (CL) of Ofatumumab at the Eighth Infusion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 9 (Week 7; up to 11 months after last dose)
secondary_outcome.description: CL is the clearance of drug from serum, which is defined as the volume of serum from which the drug is cleared per unit time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Volume of Distribution at Steady State (Vss) of Ofatumumab at the Eighth Infusion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 9 (Week 7; up to 11 months after the last dose)
secondary_outcome.description: Vss is the volume of distribution at steady state of ofatumumab.

arm_group.description: 8 weekly intra-venous (I.V.) infusions, 1 x 300mg and 7 x 1000mg

intervention.description: 8 weekly intra-venous (i.v.) infusions, 1 x 300mg and 7 x 1000mg

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Patients with DLBCL
- and relapse after complete remission or disease progression after partial remission who are ineligible for autologous stem cell transplantation
- and relapse after complete remission or disease progression after partial remission following autologous stem cell transplantation.

group.title: Ofatumumab
group.description: Participants received 8 weekly intravenous (iv) infusions of ofatumumab: first infusion of 300 milligrams (mg), followed by 7 infusions of 1000 mg

group.title: Ofatumumab
group.description: Participants received 8 weekly iv infusions of ofatumumab: first infusion of 300 mg, followed by 7 infusions of 1000 mg

measure.title: Number of Participants with the Indicated Prior Therapy
measure.description: Study participants had to have either prior autologous stem cell transplant (ASCT) or had to be ineligible for ASCT to be eligible for inclusion.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Objective Response
outcome.description: Objective response of ofatumumab treatment was assessed according to the “revised response criteria for malignant lymphoma.” Participants with objective response were defined as responders with complete remission (CR) or partial remission (PR) of disease. CR is defined as the disappearance of all evidence of disease, and PR is defined as the regression of measurable disease with no new sites of disease.
outcome.time_frame: 6-month period from start of treatment (up to Week 24)
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): all participants who were exposed to study drug irrespective of their compliance to the planned course of treatment

group.title: Ofatumumab
group.description: Participants received 8 weekly iv infusions of ofatumumab: first infusion of 300 mg, followed by 7 infusions of 1000 mg

measure.title: Number of Participants With Objective Response
measure.description: Objective response of ofatumumab treatment was assessed according to the “revised response criteria for malignant lymphoma.” Participants with objective response were defined as responders with complete remission (CR) or partial remission (PR) of disease. CR is defined as the disappearance of all evidence of disease, and PR is defined as the regression of measurable disease with no new sites of disease.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): all participants who were exposed to study drug irrespective of their compliance to the planned course of treatment

analysis.estimate_desc: Response rate is calculated as the number of responses divided by the number of participants treated, expressed as a percentage.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Classified as Responders and Non-responders for Objective Response
outcome.description: According to the "revised response criteria for malignant lymphoma," responders included participants with CR and PR, and non-responders included participants with stable disease (SD) and progressive disease (PD). Participants not evaluable (NE) were also considered to be non-responders. PD is defined as any new lesion or an increase by more than or equal to 50% of previously involved sites from baseline. SD is defined as failure to attain CR, PR, or PD.
outcome.time_frame: 6-month period from start of treatment (up to Week 24)

group.title: Ofatumumab
group.description: Participants received 8 weekly iv infusions of ofatumumab: first infusion of 300 mg, followed by 7 infusions of 1000 mg

measure.title: Number of Participants Classified as Responders and Non-responders for Objective Response
measure.description: According to the "revised response criteria for malignant lymphoma," responders included participants with CR and PR, and non-responders included participants with stable disease (SD) and progressive disease (PD). Participants not evaluable (NE) were also considered to be non-responders. PD is defined as any new lesion or an increase by more than or equal to 50% of previously involved sites from baseline. SD is defined as failure to attain CR, PR, or PD.

outcome.title: Duration of Response
outcome.description: The duration of response was defined as the time from the initial response (CR or PR) to the time of relapse, progression, or death. If the participant was lost to follow-up, the endpoint was censored, and the censoring date was the date of the last attended visit at which the endpoint was assessed.
outcome.time_frame: From date of start of treatment to 2 years or withdrawal
outcome.population: FAS. Only participants with CR or PR were analyzed.

group.title: Ofatumumab
group.description: Participants received 8 weekly iv infusions of ofatumumab: first infusion of 300 mg, followed by 7 infusions of 1000 mg

measure.title: Duration of Response
measure.description: The duration of response was defined as the time from the initial response (CR or PR) to the time of relapse, progression, or death. If the participant was lost to follow-up, the endpoint was censored, and the censoring date was the date of the last attended visit at which the endpoint was assessed.
measure.population: FAS. Only participants with CR or PR were analyzed.

measurement_list.measurement: Too few participants experienced the event to estimate the upper limit of the confidence interval.

outcome.title: Progression-free Survival (PFS)
outcome.description: PFS was defined as the time from treatment start until progression or death.
outcome.time_frame: From date of start of treatment to 2 years or withdrawal

group.title: Ofatumumab
group.description: Participants received 8 weekly iv infusions of ofatumumab: first infusion of 300 mg, followed by 7 infusions of 1000 mg

measure.title: Progression-free Survival (PFS)
measure.description: PFS was defined as the time from treatment start until progression or death.

outcome.description: Time to next DLBCL therapy was defined as the time from the first infusion date to the time of the first administration of the next DLBCL treatment other than ofatumumab. If the participants were lost to follow-up, the endpoint was censored, and the censoring date was the date of the last attended visit at which the endpoint was assessed.
outcome.time_frame: From date of start of treatment to 5 years or withdrawal

group.title: Ofatumumab
group.description: Participants received 8 weekly iv infusions of ofatumumab: first infusion of 300 mg, followed by 7 infusions of 1000 mg

measure.title: Time to Next Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma (DLBCL) Therapy
measure.description: Time to next DLBCL therapy was defined as the time from the first infusion date to the time of the first administration of the next DLBCL treatment other than ofatumumab. If the participants were lost to follow-up, the endpoint was censored, and the censoring date was the date of the last attended visit at which the endpoint was assessed.

measurement_list.measurement: Too few participants experienced the event to estimate the median and the upper limit of the confidence interval.

outcome.title: Overall Survival (OS)
outcome.description: Overall survival is defined as the time from first infusion to death. Overall survival was a secondary endpoint in the study. However, since many participants withdrew from the study after developing disease progression overall survival could not be reliably estimated.
outcome.time_frame: From date of start of treatment to 5 years or withdrawal

group.title: Ofatumumab
group.description: Participants received 8 weekly iv infusions of ofatumumab: first infusion of 300 mg, followed by 7 infusions of 1000 mg

measure.title: Overall Survival (OS)
measure.description: Overall survival is defined as the time from first infusion to death. Overall survival was a secondary endpoint in the study. However, since many participants withdrew from the study after developing disease progression overall survival could not be reliably estimated.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Positive Human Anti-human Antibodies (HAHA) at Screening and at Visits 12, 13, 14, and 18
outcome.description: HAHA are indicators of immune response to ofatumumab. Blood samples were collected from participants at Visits 1, 12, 13, 14, and 18 and analyzed in batches. The number of participants with positive results at each visit is reported.
outcome.time_frame: Screening visit (=<14 days before treatment start), Visit 12 (Month 6), Visit 13 (Month 9), Visit 14 (Month 12), and Visit 18 (Month 24)
outcome.population: FAS. Data are provided for the number of participants attending each visit.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Positive Human Anti-human Antibodies (HAHA) at Screening and at Visits 12, 13, 14, and 18
measure.description: HAHA are indicators of immune response to ofatumumab. Blood samples were collected from participants at Visits 1, 12, 13, 14, and 18 and analyzed in batches. The number of participants with positive results at each visit is reported.
measure.population: FAS. Data are provided for the number of participants attending each visit.

outcome.title: Median Percent Change From Baseline in CD45+CD19+ and CD45+CD20+ Cells in the Peripheral Blood at the Indicated Visits
outcome.description: B cells (CD45+CD19+ and CD45+CD20+) were measured in peripheral blood samples by flow cytometry. Percent change from Baseline = (value at the indicated visits minus the value at Baseline divided by the value at Baseline) * 100.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Visit 10 (Week 8), Visit 11 (Week 11), Visit 12 (Month 6), Visit 13 (Month 9), Visit 14 (Month 12), Visit 15 (Month 15), Visit 16 (Month 18), Visit 17 (Month 21), Visit 18 (Month 24), Visit 19 (Month 30), Visit 20 (Month 36)
outcome.population: FAS. Data are provided for the number of participants attending each visit.

group.title: Ofatumumab
group.description: Participants received 8 weekly iv infusions of ofatumumab: first infusion of 300 mg, followed by 7 infusions of 1000 mg

measure.title: Median Percent Change From Baseline in CD45+CD19+ and CD45+CD20+ Cells in the Peripheral Blood at the Indicated Visits
measure.description: B cells (CD45+CD19+ and CD45+CD20+) were measured in peripheral blood samples by flow cytometry. Percent change from Baseline = (value at the indicated visits minus the value at Baseline divided by the value at Baseline) * 100.
measure.population: FAS. Data are provided for the number of participants attending each visit.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Experienced at Least One Adverse Event (AE)
outcome.description: An AE is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant administered a pharmaceutical product that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. The protocol-defined AE reporting period was from the first infusion (Visit 2/Week 0) to Visit 18 (Month 24 of follow-up) or time of withdrawal (treatment and follow-up).
outcome.time_frame: Time frame is from date of start of treatment to 2 years or withdrawal

group.title: Ofatumumab
group.description: Participants received 8 weekly iv infusions of ofatumumab: first infusion of 300 mg, followed by 7 infusions of 1000 mg

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Experienced at Least One Adverse Event (AE)
measure.description: An AE is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant administered a pharmaceutical product that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. The protocol-defined AE reporting period was from the first infusion (Visit 2/Week 0) to Visit 18 (Month 24 of follow-up) or time of withdrawal (treatment and follow-up).

outcome.title: Percent Change From Screening in Complement (CH50) Levels
outcome.description: CH50 was mistakenly registered as an outcome measure with the protocol record. Samples were not collected, and no analysis will take place. Thus, no data will be reported for this outcome measure.
outcome.time_frame: Screening and post-baseline visits (last visit was to occur 24 months post first dose)

group.title: Ofatumumab
group.description: Participants received 8 weekly iv infusions of ofatumumab: first infusion of 300 mg, followed by 7 infusions of 1000 mg

measure.title: Percent Change From Screening in Complement (CH50) Levels
measure.description: CH50 was mistakenly registered as an outcome measure with the protocol record. Samples were not collected, and no analysis will take place. Thus, no data will be reported for this outcome measure.

outcome.title: AUC(0-inf) and AUC(0-168) for Ofatumumab at the Eighth Infusion
outcome.description: AUC is defined as the area under the ofatumumab concentration-time curve as a measure of drug exposure. AUC(0-168) is the AUC from the start of infusion to 168 hours after the start of the infusion; AUC(0-inf) is the AUC from the start of infusion extrapolated to infinity.
outcome.time_frame: Visit 9 (Week 7; up to 11 months after last dose)
outcome.population: FAS. Data are provided for the number of participants attending each visit for whom the parameter value could be calculated. Participants contributing AUC(0-inf) data also contributed AUC(0-168) data.

group.title: Ofatumumab
group.description: Participants received 8 weekly iv infusions of ofatumumab: first infusion of 300 mg, followed by 7 infusions of 1000 mg

measure.title: AUC(0-inf) and AUC(0-168) for Ofatumumab at the Eighth Infusion
measure.description: AUC is defined as the area under the ofatumumab concentration-time curve as a measure of drug exposure. AUC(0-168) is the AUC from the start of infusion to 168 hours after the start of the infusion; AUC(0-inf) is the AUC from the start of infusion extrapolated to infinity.
measure.population: FAS. Data are provided for the number of participants attending each visit for whom the parameter value could be calculated. Participants contributing AUC(0-inf) data also contributed AUC(0-168) data.

outcome.title: Cmax and Ctrough for Ofatumumab at the First and Eighth Infusions
outcome.description: Cmax is defined as the maximum concentration of drug in serum samples. Ctrough is defined as the minimum observed concentration prior to the start of the next dose. No drug is present prior to the first infusion; therefore, there are no Ctrough results for the first dose.
outcome.population: FAS. Data are provided for the number of participants attending each visit.

measure.title: Cmax and Ctrough for Ofatumumab at the First and Eighth Infusions
measure.description: Cmax is defined as the maximum concentration of drug in serum samples. Ctrough is defined as the minimum observed concentration prior to the start of the next dose. No drug is present prior to the first infusion; therefore, there are no Ctrough results for the first dose.
measure.population: FAS. Data are provided for the number of participants attending each visit.

outcome.title: Half-life (T1/2) for Ofatumumab at the Eighth Infusion
outcome.description: t1/2 is defined as terminal half-life and is the time required for the amount of drug in the body to decrease by half.
outcome.time_frame: Visit 9 (Week 7; up to 11 months after last dose)
outcome.population: FAS. Data are provided for the number of participants at each visit for whom the parameter could be calculated.

measure.title: Half-life (T1/2) for Ofatumumab at the Eighth Infusion
measure.description: t1/2 is defined as terminal half-life and is the time required for the amount of drug in the body to decrease by half.
measure.population: FAS. Data are provided for the number of participants at each visit for whom the parameter could be calculated.

outcome.title: Clearance (CL) of Ofatumumab at the Eighth Infusion
outcome.description: CL is the clearance of drug from serum, which is defined as the volume of serum from which the drug is cleared per unit time.
outcome.time_frame: Visit 9 (Week 7; up to 11 months after last dose)
outcome.population: FAS. Data are presented for the number of participants at each visit for whom the parameter can be calculated.

measure.title: Clearance (CL) of Ofatumumab at the Eighth Infusion
measure.description: CL is the clearance of drug from serum, which is defined as the volume of serum from which the drug is cleared per unit time.
measure.population: FAS. Data are presented for the number of participants at each visit for whom the parameter can be calculated.

outcome.title: Volume of Distribution at Steady State (Vss) of Ofatumumab at the Eighth Infusion
outcome.description: Vss is the volume of distribution at steady state of ofatumumab.
outcome.time_frame: Visit 9 (Week 7; up to 11 months after the last dose)
outcome.population: FAS. Data are presented for the number of participants attending each visit for whom the parameter can be calculated.

group.title: Ofatumumab
group.description: Participants received 8 weekly iv infusions of ofatumumab: first infusion of 300 mg, followed by 7 infusions of 1000 mg

measure.title: Volume of Distribution at Steady State (Vss) of Ofatumumab at the Eighth Infusion
measure.description: Vss is the volume of distribution at steady state of ofatumumab.
measure.population: FAS. Data are presented for the number of participants attending each visit for whom the parameter can be calculated.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events (AE) were reported from first infusion (Week 0) to Month 24 of follow-up (FU)/withdrawal (treatment and FU). Serious AEs were reported through Month 60 (treatment, FU, and extended FU).

group.title: Ofatumumab
group.description: Participants received 8 weekly iv infusions of ofatumumab: first infusion of 300 mg, followed by 7 infusions of 1000 mg

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
